Problem:

If an intervention by applying another transformation \\(g(u) = u \\cdot e^{-\\mu t}\\) at t=T1 is executed, will the wave form at t=T (T > T1) depend only on the initial conditions set by \\(u_0\\) and not on \\(\\lambda\\) or \\(\\mu\\)?
Explanation: The intervention of \\(g(u)\\) at t=T1 imposes an additional transformation that counteracts or enhances the modification by \\(\\lambda\\), making the final state at t=T dependent on both \\(\\lambda\\) and \\(\\mu\\), as they both significantly alter the wave amplitude dynamically.
